newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SA Druggists unit wins Dutch export order.
newsitem.headline: SA Druggists unit wins Dutch export order.

text.p: South African Druggists Ltd's Pharmacare Ltd unit said on Thursday it had won an order to export painkillers to the Netherlands.
The order, from Dutch firm Synthon BV, covers one million Fentanyl Citrate ampoules, used for pre-operative sedation and the management of post-operative pain.
"We believe this order is just the beginning and that we will see many more similar orders coming our way this year," said Pharmacare chief executive Kobus Nel.
Pharmacre already exports to 39 countries and its Intramed factory in Port Elizabeth was recently given an ISO 9002 certification -- a standards award that will help it win European export contracts.
Nels said an unnamed Norwegian firm was currently registering the Intramed plant as a manufacturer of one of its drugs.
"Without the ISO 9002 rating its is doubtful that we would have been considered as contract manufacturers for Europe," he said.
